content:
• Tuesday, February 5, 2013
  • JIVE

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Jive Software (JIVE - earnings) expects Q1 revenue $33.5M-$34.5M and...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Jive Software (JIVE - earnings) expects Q1 revenue $33.5M-$34.5M and EPS of -$0.15 to -$0.17 vs. a consensus of $34M and -$0.08. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $148M-$153M and EPS of -$0.53 to -$0.60 vs. a consensus of $151.3M and -$0.27. 2) Silicon Image (SIMG - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $59M-$61M vs. a $60.3M consensus. 3) Trimble (TRMB - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $575M-$580M and EPS of $0.74-$0.76, above a consensus of $573.2M and $0.73. JIVE -1.7% AH. SIMG +5.9%. TRMB -0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM
  • MYGN

    More on Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN): FQ2 easily beats Street estimates on a 21% Y/Y jump in...

    More on Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN): FQ2 easily beats Street estimates on a 21% Y/Y jump in total sales. Molecular diagnostic testing revenue +20%, Oncology +16%, and Women's Health +27% over the prior year period. The company raises FY13 guidance, now expecting to earn between $1.55 - $1.58 per share on revenue of around $575M to $585M. Street estimates are for an EPS of $1.54 on revenue of $580M. Shares +1.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM
  • SFLY

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SFLY +16%. CSGS +13%. PIKE +10%. ZNGA +8%. TTWO +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SFLY +16%. CSGS +13%. PIKE +10%. ZNGA +8%. TTWO +5%.
    After-hours top losers: GLUU -5%. HAIN -4%. TTMI -4%. XLS -3%. WAG -3%.

  • EXPE

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) +4.1% AH and Priceline (PCLN) +2.3% thanks to Expedia's Q4 report, which...

    Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) +4.1% AH and Priceline (PCLN) +2.3% thanks to Expedia's Q4 report, which featured a strong revenue beat to go with a slight EPS miss. Gross bookings rose 19% Y/Y, matching Q3's growth. Hotel room nights +33% (27% in Q3), rates -3%. Air tickets +12% (boosted by VIA Travel acquisition), airfares +2%. Domestic bookings +11%, international +32% and now 44% of global bookings (42% in Q3). Costs/expenses +26%, a little above revenue growth. No shares repurchased. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) +2.2% AH after announcing a 3-for-2 stock split. Shares will begin trading...

    3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) +2.2% AH after announcing a 3-for-2 stock split. Shares will begin trading on a split-adjusted basis on Feb. 25. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 14 Comments

    CSG Systems (NASDAQ:CSGS): Q4 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $198M (+6% Y/Y) beats by...

    CSG Systems (NASDAQ:CSGS): Q4 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $198M (+6% Y/Y) beats by $10.49M. Shares +12.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • MXL

    MaxLinear (NYSE:MXL): Q4 EPS of $0.02 in-line. Revenue of $24.8M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $0.7M....

    MaxLinear (NYSE:MXL): Q4 EPS of $0.02 in-line. Revenue of $24.8M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $0.7M. Shares +1.11% AH. (PR)

    Pike Electric (NYSE:PIKE): FQ2 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $273.7M (+59% Y/Y) beats...

    Pike Electric (NYSE:PIKE): FQ2 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $273.7M (+59% Y/Y) beats by $35.65M. Shares +10.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • HPQ

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) +4% AH after Quartz reports the company's board is "studying a break-up," among...

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) +4% AH after Quartz reports the company's board is "studying a break-up," among other options for boosting shareholder value. An H-P breakup has been discussed by many a pundit, investor, and analyst, with opinions about its merits varying greatly. Dan Primack suggests taking the report in stride. "The HP board of directors is doing what boards of directors are paid to do: Evaluating all possible options." Update: AllThingsD's Arik Hesseldahl reports "no active board discussions" about a breakup are underway.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • NOA

    North American Energy (NYSE:NOA): FQ3 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $189M misses by...

    North American Energy (NYSE:NOA): FQ3 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $189M misses by $23.5M. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • TTWO

    Following a halt, Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) is up 6.2% AH thanks to its FQ3 beat. The game...

    Following a halt, Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) is up 6.2% AH thanks to its FQ3 beat. The game developer is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $235M-$285M and EPS of $0.10-$0.25, below a consensus of $303.4M and $0.36, but it has a habit of issuing guidance like that. A 7.5M-share buyback (good for repurchasing 8.2% of outstanding shares) has been authorized. Strong sales of NBA 2K13 and Borderlands 2 contributed to the beat. "Digitally delivered content" is now up to 23% of revenue. CC underway (webcast). (GTA V delay)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) has resumed trading and is up 13% AH thanks to a blowout Q4 report....

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) has resumed trading and is up 13% AH thanks to a blowout Q4 report. Guidance is also helping: Shutterfly expects Q1 revenue of $107--$110M and 2013 revenue of $739.7M-$746M; the former is in-line, but the latter is well above a $707.8M consensus. Transacting customers +30% Y/Y to 4.2M, orders +33% to 6.9M, average order value flat at $49.80. Gross margin rose 160 bps Y/Y to 60.5%. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • CERN

    More on Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN): Q4 beats consensus estimates on a 13% gain in total sales. Net...

    More on Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN): Q4 beats consensus estimates on a 13% gain in total sales. Net profit rose 23% Y/Y on double-digit revenue gains from its two main segments as well as record bookings, totaling $1.02B, an all-time high and a 13% increase from the prior year. Support, maintenance and services revenue - its biggest top-line contributor - jumped 16%, while system sales revenue was up 14%. Total backlog rose 19% to $7.27B. Shares +4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) now -2.8% AH in response to the light guidance accompanying its Q4 beat...

    Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) now -2.8% AH in response to the light guidance accompanying its Q4 beat - a huge 2H12 selloff is limiting the damage. Glu blames its Q1 forecast on "seasonality and further delays in title launches." The game developer, which ended 2012 with $22.3M in cash/equivalents, expects to end 2013 with $14M, and insists it won't need to raise fresh capital. Sales/marketing expenses +57% Y/Y to $6.3M (30% of revenue). CC underway (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • CME

    CME Group (NASDAQ:CME): Q4 EPS of $0.63 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $660M (-11% Y/Y) misses by...

    CME Group (NASDAQ:CME): Q4 EPS of $0.63 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $660M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $3M. (PR) Shares -0.7% AH.

    Silicon Image (NASDAQ:SIMG): Q4 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $59.6M (+2% Y/Y) beats...

    USANA (NYSE:USNA): Q4 EPS of $1.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $168.5M (+15.5% Y/Y) beats by $2.7M. Shares -6.5% AH. (PR)

    Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN): Q4 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $710M (+13% Y/Y) beats by $15M....

    Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): Q4 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $455.3M (+24.8% Y/Y)...

    Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN): Q4 EPS of $0.72 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $455.3M (+24.8% Y/Y) misses by $18.14M. Shares -4.4% AH. (PR)

    Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR): Q4 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $89.7M misses by $1.M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)

  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA): Q4 EPS of $0.01 beats by $0.04. Bookings of $261.3M (-15% Y/Y) beats by...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA): Q4 EPS of $0.01 beats by $0.04. Bookings of $261.3M (-15% Y/Y) beats by $50.2M. Expects Q1 bookings of $200M-$210M and EPS of -$0.05 to -$0.04, below consensus of $240M and -$0.01. Expects 2013 adjusted EBITDA margin of 0%-10%. Shares +5.5% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • LBTYA

    A deal for Liberty Global (LBTYA -2.7%) to acquire Virgin Media (VMED +18.2%) has been struck,...

    A deal for Liberty Global (LBTYA -2.7%) to acquire Virgin Media (VMED +18.2%) has been struck, according to reporting from CNBC. David Faber says the final deal price is below $50.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • CHTR

    Shares of Charter Communications (CHTR +8.5%) are flying higher with the talk on the street...

    Shares of Charter Communications (CHTR +8.5%) are flying higher with the talk on the street saying a deal with a larger company could be on tap. Also adding to the buzz, Lone Capital upped its stake in the company to 7.1%. (13G).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • TECH

    Techne (TECH -1.4%) slips after its FQ2 missed consensus estimates earlier on flat revenue...

    Techne (TECH -1.4%) slips after its FQ2 missed consensus estimates earlier on flat revenue growth. Net sales grew 0.6% for the quarter, while organic sales grew 1.3% over the same period. Biotechnology declined by 2.1%, while its hematology segment gained 12.4%. SG&A expenses were higher and negatively impacting margins, which declined to 76.2% from 77.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • EOX

    Emerald Oil (EOX +6.8%) is upgraded to Buy at Global Hunter in response to a "positive"...

    Emerald Oil (EOX +6.8%) is upgraded to Buy at Global Hunter in response to a "positive" conversion from a non-operating E&P company to an operator of oil-focused Bakken wells. Also, the $50M capital infusion improves EOX's access to capital and reduces capital risk in the event of declining crude prices or subpar initial well results, unlikely given adjacent well results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • EW

    Jefferies analyst Raj Denhoy comes out defending Edwards Lifesciences (EW -6.5%) on weakness...

    Jefferies analyst Raj Denhoy comes out defending Edwards Lifesciences (EW -6.5%) on weakness today, reiterating his Buy rating and upping his price target to $114 from $100. Denhoy says its quarter was solid, and the higher price target is due to strong US Sapien transcatheter heart valve sales, which are tracking ahead of expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • PRGO

    Perrigo (PRGO +1.6%) receives FDA approval to market its generic testosterone gel 1%. The...

    Perrigo (PRGO +1.6%) receives FDA approval to market its generic testosterone gel 1%. The product is a generic version of AbbVie's (ABBV +0.4%) AndroGel 1%, which is indicated to treat adult males who have low or no testosterone.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • SWI

    SolarWinds (SWI -5.3%) is lower after posting its Q4 report. Results beat estimates and Q1...

    SolarWinds (SWI -5.3%) is lower after posting its Q4 report. Results beat estimates and Q1 guidance for revenue of $74.9M-$75.7M and EPS of $0.37 is above a consensus of $74.6M and $0.35. Also, 2013 guidance for revenue of $330M-$338M and EPS of $1.57-$1.62 is largely above a consensus of  $331.5M and $1.55. But with shares trading at 36x 2013E EPS going in, expectations were high. Management noted on the earnings call EMEA and Asia-Pac new license sales respectively rose 47% and 39% Y/Y, leading international sales to make up 27% of revenue (vs. 22% in Q3).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • ASEI

    American Science & Engineering (ASEI -4%) takes a hit on a downgrade to Hold on valuation at...

    American Science & Engineering (ASEI -4%) takes a hit on a downgrade to Hold on valuation at Benchmark. The firms thinks ASEI is faced with lackluster growth FY13 and possibly into FY14 as well due to soft bookings from government delays and economic uncertainty. Additionally, the large Foreign Military Sales requirement from Iraq is likely to be delayed due to funding constraints.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • GOL

    Brazilian airline GOL Linhas (GOL +2%) says it's taking a one-time impact charge of BRL140M...

    Brazilian airline GOL Linhas (GOL +2%) says it's taking a one-time impact charge of BRL140M ($70M) in Q4 due to the shutdown of recently acquired WebJet. The estimated costs are largely due to personnel costs and provisions for the return and maintenance of it's aircraft. At the end of last year, GOL said it was eliminating the WebJet brand, cutting 850 jobs and returnig 20 aircraft by the end of the first half of this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • AAPL

    9to5Mac digs through iOS 6.1 (NASDAQ:AAPL) and discovers what it believes are the building...

    9to5Mac digs through iOS 6.1 (NASDAQ:AAPL) and discovers what it believes are the building blocks of a much speculated but never confirmed streaming radio service to compete with Pandora (NYSE:P), Spotify & co. P gives up earlier gains, now +0.35%. AAPL +3.35% on the day to $457.15.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 9 Comments
  • GME

    GameStop (GME +6.2%) rallies again in an extended move traced back to a glowing report issued...

    GameStop (GME +6.2%) rallies again in an extended move traced back to a glowing report issued last week from Piper Jaffray. Shares are up close to 16% since the firm called out the GameStop to see a strong H1 with the software release schedule looking promising. In an interview with Bloomberg, GameStop President Tony Bartel says the firm is starting a mobile development arm to help fund projects and denies rumors circulating around that it will close hundreds of stores.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • CAH

    Cardinal Health (CAH +1.6%) puts up a decent FQ2 report this morning, despite weaker revenue out...

    Cardinal Health (CAH +1.6%) puts up a decent FQ2 report this morning, despite weaker revenue out of its pharmaceutical unit, due in part to brand-to-generic conversions and the loss of the Express Scripts business. Net earnings still managed to rise by 16% Y/Y however, as the drug wholesaler posted better margins. Revenue in its pharmaceutical business its largest by revenue, declined 8%, while its medical business increased by 3%, boosted by last year's acquisition of FutureMed and an additional sales day.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple's (AAPL +3.4%) sell-side fans are beginning to insist the company needs a bigger iPhone....

    Apple's (AAPL +3.4%) sell-side fans are beginning to insist the company needs a bigger iPhone. Barclays' Ben Reitzes sees the market for smartphones with 5"+ displays growing to 230M units in 2015 from 27M in 2012, and thinks a large iPhone could boost ASPs by ~5% and 2014 EPS by $7. Sterne Agee's Shaw Wu offers a similar take. "We believe AAPL is leaving money on the table by not participating in larger touchscreen form factors." Wu adds he's seeing evidence of a strategy change in supplier checks. (Blodget) (Wozniak)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 33 Comments
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks are spiking. The move may be related to a news item dated Jan. 30 and released...

    Solar stocks are spiking. The move may be related to a news item dated Jan. 30 and released today about a tax ruling that would clear the way for solar farms to be clasified as REITs. FSLR +6.8%. SPWR +6.3%. TSL +5.2%. YGE +4.2%. STP +3.8%. TAN +3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • ACER

    Midday top 10 gainers: OPXA +189%. CEP +31%. SCKT +23%. PLX +18%. CPSS +18%. VMED +17%. TRT...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OPXA +189%. CEP +31%. SCKT +23%. PLX +18%. CPSS +18%. VMED +17%. TRT +17%. STV +16%. BCOM +15%. CNR +15%.
    Midday top 10 losers: DCIX -13%. IEC -13%. PRPH -11%. BIDU -11%. ACI -11%. OTC:PGRX -10%. JAXB -10%. DFZ -10%. RTEC -9%. SGMS -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • OA

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK +2.6%) gains after its FQ3 beats on its bottom line, despite declining...

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK +2.6%) gains after its FQ3 beats on its bottom line, despite declining revenue. Net earnings rose 27% Y/Y, as the defense contractor racked up lower SG&A expenses and input costs. Aerospace sales were virtually flat, while the defense group dropped 18% to $467M, driven by lower sales in the small caliber systems and energetics divisions. In the sporting group however, sales climbed 18% to $288M, boosted by higher unit volume and ammunition price increases. The company raises FY guidance, now forecasting earnings of $7.90 to $8.10 a share on revenue of $4.25B to $4.3B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD -1.7%) is downgraded to Underweight with a $5 price target (down from...

    SandRidge Energy (SD -1.7%) is downgraded to Underweight with a $5 price target (down from $9.50) at J.P. Morgan, citing too much risk relative to any potential upside. The firm says if TPG-Axon wins its consent solicitation, the stock probably moves up, but the stock likely gets hit hard if it loses. Regardless, SD seems to need extraordinary measures to avoid a financial crunch.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 4 Comments
  • BDX

    Becton Dickinson (BDX +2.8%) moves up after its FQ1 easily tops estimates. Net profit more than...

    Becton Dickinson (BDX +2.8%) moves up after its FQ1 easily tops estimates. Net profit more than doubled on revenue growth across all segments, while margins widened to 52.9% from 50.8%. Sales in its U.S. markets grew by 3% Y/Y, and 4.3% internationally. Sales in its medical unit, the largest by revenue, rose 3.5%. For the current year, The company bumps up the bottom end of revenue guidance, now expecting revenue growth starting at 4% versus its prior view of 3.5%, and an EPS of between $5.69 and $5.72, up from its earlier view of $5.58 to $5.64.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • BTU

    When one coal miner coughs, they all catch cold. Peabody (BTU -2.5%) dragged the sector down...

    When one coal miner coughs, they all catch cold. Peabody (BTU -2.5%) dragged the sector down last week when it reported its quarter, and Arch Coal’s (ACI -9%) Q4 is having the same effect: ANR -1.6%, WLT -1.2%. Like BTU, ACI says it sees signs of a possible recovery in domestic coal during H2 2013, but those signs will evaporate unless natural gas prices move closer to $4/million BTUs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • CASM

    CAS Medical Systems (CASM +6.1%) moves up today after the company announced results from a key...

    CAS Medical Systems (CASM +6.1%) moves up today after the company announced results from a key study showing otherwise unrecognized cerebral desaturation events occurred in more than half of post-surgical ICU patients. The study revealed that 53% of the patients studied suffered from low levels of brain oxygen that were otherwise unrecognized by standard monitoring, and of those suffering from the malady, 18% died. CASM - which makes the FORE-SIGHT Absolute Cerebral Oximeter - says the data suggests that there may be an important role for cerebral oximetry monitoring in the ICU.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • MTDR

    Matador Resources (MTDR +2.6%) says proved oil and natural gas reserves at year-end 2012 totaled...

    Matador Resources (MTDR +2.6%) says proved oil and natural gas reserves at year-end 2012 totaled 23.8M boe. Proved oil reserves of 10.5M barrels comprised 44% of total proved reserves, vs. 12% a year ago, attributable to its ongoing drilling program in the Eagle Ford shale. Proved natural gas reserves of 80B cu. ft. declined from 170.4B a year ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • ZNGA

    More on BofA's two-notch upgrade of Zynga (ZNGA +5.3%): The firm, which is raising its PT to...

    More on BofA's two-notch upgrade of Zynga (ZNGA +5.3%): The firm, which is raising its PT to $3.40 from $2.70, thinks Q4/2012 bookings could beat guidance when Zynga reports today. It also thinks mobile trends have stabilized (plummeting activity for Draw Something took a toll on Q3 results), and argues downside is limited by $2.20/share in cash and assets, a $200M/year online poker business, and a $150M-$200M/year mobile business.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • SPGI

    Joining the DOJ in filing sut aginst S&P (MHP -5.6%) are a number of states, including...

    Joining the DOJ in filing sut aginst S&P (MHP -5.6%) are a number of states, including California, where AG Harris is suing under the state's False Claims Act. This would allow CA to collect triple damages on what it says were $1B in losses. Earlier joining McGraw Hill in tanking, Moody's (NYSE:MCO) - maybe enjoying the political protection of having The Oracle as an investor - returns to near-unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 12 Comments
  • PRPH

    ProPhase Labs (PRPH -20%), maker of Cold-EEZE, takes a hit this morning after Matrixx...

    ProPhase Labs (PRPH -20%), maker of Cold-EEZE, takes a hit this morning after Matrixx Initiatives announced today that it has withdrawn its $1.60 per share offer it made to acquire the company back in October.Matrix initially offered $1.40 per share for the company back in September of last year, but then upped its bid to $1.60 soon after after. PRPH rejected both bids out-of-hand.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • SBGL

    Stillwater Mining (SWC +3.8%) is upgraded to Overweight from Neutral with a $19 price target...

    Stillwater Mining (SWC +3.8%) is upgraded to Overweight from Neutral with a $19 price target (from $14) at J.P. Morgan on improving palladium fundamentals as Russian supplies fall and demand for diesel autocatalysts rises. With Europe likely to move to new emission standards by 2014, the firm expects manufacturers to switch to a more cost effective mix that would lift palladium demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • SPGI

    Attorney General Holder puts a $5B-plus target on how much S&P (MHP -6.5%) defrauded...

    Attorney General Holder puts a $5B-plus target on how much S&P (MHP -6.5%) defrauded investors through faulty ratings on MBS, and says the DOJ is going after all of it. "S&P misled investors ... causing them to lose billions of dollars." S&P alone? (earlier: Even $3B seems far too high)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 34 Comments
  • AUXL

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL +0.3%) and strategic partner BioSpecifics (BSTC +1.3%) both move...

    Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL +0.3%) and strategic partner BioSpecifics (BSTC +1.3%) both move up after The Journal of Urology publishes its Impress Study, a Phase 3 trial of Xiaflex for the treatment of Peyronie's disease, which is an excess of inelastic collagen causing penile curvature deformity. AUXL previously announced positive top-line efficacy and safety results of the studies' co-primary endpoints, and based on the new results, has submitted a supplemental Biologics License Application (sBLA) to the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • APC

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC +2.1%) is off to a strong start after reporting an "on-pace quarter" and...

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC +2.1%) is off to a strong start after reporting an "on-pace quarter" and "surprising to the upside regularly." Q4 was a “good beat after adjustments, driven by higher output, lower costs and derivatives," GHS Research says, expecting a "busy"Q1 with active Gulf of Mexico presence and potential for a JV or other partnerships in fields in Mozambique.
